column2: IOWA PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
column4: Iowa
column6: IA

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. If there is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrian crossing your lane, you should:
column4: stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing.
column6: honk your horn and proceed with caution.
column8: make sure the pedestrian can see you before proceeding.

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column4: Turn right or go through
column6: Crossroads ahead
column8: Flagger ahead

column2: 3. A 4-way stop sign means:
column4: The first vehicle to reach the intersection should move forward first.
column6: Traffic from all four directions must stop.
column8: There are four stop signs at the intersection.

column2: 4. You should increase your following distance:
column4: when the roads are slippery.
column6: at night or if it is raining.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 5. A broken yellow line alongside a solid yellow line means:
column4: Passing on the right is permitted in either direction
column6: Passing is permitted on the side of the broken yellow line
column8: Passing is not permitted in either direction
column10: Passing is permitted on the side of the solid yellow line

column2: 6. A flashing red light means:
column4: The same as a STOP sign.
column6: The traffic signal is broken.
column8: The light will soon change to steady red.

column2: 7. Before you change lanes, you should:
column4: look for other traffic by turning your head and looking behind you for oncoming traffic.
column6: check your left mirror.
column8: keep other vehicles out of your blind spots.

column2: 8. If the rear of your car is skidding to the left:
column4: do not turn your steering wheel until you are through skidding.
column6: steer to the left to correct the skid.
column8: steer to the right to correct the skid.

column2: 9. This sign means:
column4: Do not to enter if your vehicle is taller than the height listed on the sign.
column6: No passing zone ahead.
column8: Narrow bridge ahead. Slow down and drive with caution.

column2: 10. The sign in the picture:
column4: is displayed on the rear of slow moving vehicles.
column6: means that you need to stop.
column8: is found at most intersections and indicates that drivers must yield to other vehicles.
column10: is a Construction and Maintenance Traffic Control sign.

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column4: Trucks under 12,000 lbs. allowed
column6: No trucks allowed
column8: Hill or downgrade up ahead

column2: 12. When is the pavement most slippery?
column4: If it's been raining several hours.
column6: When it's been raining from at least one hour.
column8: When it has just begun to rain.

column2: 13. A vehicle that enters a road from a driveway:
column4: has the right-of-way.
column6: must enter the roadway immediately.
column8: must yield to traffic approaching from the right, while it has the right-of-way over vehicles approaching from the left.
column10: must stop and yield the right-of-way to traffic on the roadway and to pedestrians.

column2: 14. At intersections, crosswalks, and railroad crossings, drivers should always:
column4: slowly pass vehicles the vehicles ahead.
column6: stop, listen for oncoming traffic, and proceed with caution.
column8: look to the sides of their vehicle to see what is coming.

column2: 15. When a school bus is picking up or dropping off children, you must:
column4: slow down and pass the bus with caution.
column6: stop if you are driving in the same direction.
column8: stop regardless of your direction of travel.

column2: 16. BAC is:
column4: the amount of alcohol in your body.
column6: the number of ounces of alcohol in your blood.
column8: the percentage of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 17. Bicyclists must:
column4: remain to the right when they prepare for a left turn.
column6: travel with more than two side-by-side in a single lane, if possible.
column8: remain near the left edge of the road.
column10: ride in a bicycle lane, if available.

column2: 18. What should you do when an aggressive driver confronts you?
column4: Avoid eye contact with the aggressive driver.
column6: Return gestures and shouts.
column8: Make eye contact.
column10: Challenge the aggressive driver with increased speed.

column2: 19. If an approaching driver does not dim the headlights, you should:
column4: switch to daytime lights.
column6: flash your headlights to low beam for a second, then return to high beam.
column8: move your eyes to the left to help avoid the glare of approaching high beams.
column10: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.

column2: 20. Which of the following drugs could affect your ability to drive?
column4: A cold remedy.
column6: Tranquilizers.
column8: Marijuana.

column2: 21. If another car has stopped in an adjacent lane in the same direction of travel, you should:
column4: pass the car on the left.
column6: be careful in case the other vehicle has stopped for a pedestrian.
column8: tap your horn to let the other driver know you are passing.
column10: speed up and pass the vehicle on the right.

column2: 22. This road sign means:
column4: No U-turn
column6: Detour ahead
column8: No left turn

column2: 23. If an aggressive driver is behind you:
column4: increase you speed and flash your brake lights.
column6: try to get out of the aggressive driverâ€™s way.
column8: sound your horn and move to the left lane.
column10: slow down and confront the aggressive driver.

column2: 24. You can pass on the right:
column4: when a vehicle ahead makes a left turn.
column6: when a vehicle ahead makes a right turn.
column8: when a vehicle that is approaching from the opposite direction is prepared to turn left.
column10: when passing is restricted by parked cars.

column2: 25. This road sign means:
column4: No right turn
column6: Do not pass
column8: No U-turns

column2: 26. This road sign means:
column4: Yield sign ahead
column6: All traffic must turn
column8: You must turn right at the intersection

column2: 27. This road sign means:
column4: Road curves ahead
column6: Stop for other traffic
column8: Steep downgrade

column2: 28. When you meet an oncoming school bus displaying flashing amber lights, you must immediately come to a complete stop.
column4: True
column6: False

column2: 29. Which of the following is a common cause of traffic collisions?
column4: Pedestrians being key participants in the transportation system.
column6: Scanning the road ahead and staying focused on the driving task.
column8: Driving too fast for conditions.

column2: 30. The minimum drinking age in this State is ____ years.
